</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;52bad519.1409">   <title>Exciting job opp working with camera drones - Nesta </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;52bad519.1409</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>I am in the process of moving to University of Salford to take up a Chair<br>in Science Communication &amp; Digital Media.<br><br>Related to this, I am advertising a unique, part-time role of 'Creative<br>Producer &amp; Research Assistant', working with 'Project Daedalus', a NESTA,<br>ACE, and AHRC project, which will explore the creative potential of drones.<br>Project Daedalus is part of the Digital R&amp;D in the Arts fund and is<br>delivered in collaboration with Abandon Normal Devices &amp; Marshmallow Laser<br>Feast. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-26T11:29:58+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Miah</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;52bad519.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;8c4846fa.1407">   <title>Re: CAFE-SCI Digest - 3 Jun 2014 to 17 Jul 2014 (#2014-14) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;8c4846fa.1407</link>   <description> Katie-<br><br>RE: your questions about scientist talks before fiction films, here is the first thought that comes immediately to mind:<br><br>Science on Screen is a program that started here in Boston that does exactly this. They pair a talk with a film in a monthly series at a local movie house, and they have been replicating this model nationwide:<br>http://www.coolidge.org/programs/science-on-screen [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-18T14:37:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Wiehe</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;8c4846fa.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;79023944.1407">   <title>Re: talk and sci-fi movie model? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;79023944.1407</link>   <description> The Teen Science Cafe Network (teensciencecafe.org) is a community of Cafe<br>programs for high school teenagers. One of the most successful Cafes in the<br>7-year history of the New Mexico component of the TSCN (CafeNM.org) was led<br>by Russell Morton, a neuroscientist at the University of New Mexico. It was<br>a brain neuroscience program with a &quot;zombie&quot; theme. Russ showed that<br>impairment of various parts of the brain could produce zombie-like<br>behavior. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-18T09:53:06-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Mayhew</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;79023944.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;37779c62.1407">   <title>Re: talk and sci-fi movie model? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;37779c62.1407</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>We have done it a couple of times in the Green Film Festival in Portsmouth,<br>but without any evaluation. The Green Film Festival is 3 years old and so<br>still has a lot of tweaking needed.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Maricar Jagger<br><br>Mrs Maricar Jagger<br>Public Relations Officer (Corporate Events)<br>Press &amp; PR Team<br>Marketing &amp; Communications Department<br>St Andrew's Court<br>St Michael's Road<br>Portsmouth<br>PO1 2PR [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-18T10:17:09+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Maricar Jagger</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;37779c62.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;e177926e.1407">   <title>Re: talk and sci-fi movie model? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;e177926e.1407</link>   <description> See the blog post written by Museum botanist, Paul Sokoloff about the natural history of Star Wars When we hosted a related adult event: http://canadianmuseumofnature.wordpress.com/2013/08/01/the-natural-history-of-star-wars-part-i/<br><br>Enjoy!<br><br>Laurel McIvor<br>Project Lead, Nature Inspiration Centre<br>Charg\ufffd\ufffd de projet, Centre d\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdinspiration de la nature<br><br>Canadian Museum of Nature / Mus\ufffd\ufffde canadien de la nature<br>CP 3443 Succ \ufffd\ufffd D \ufffd\ufffd / PO Box 3443 Stn \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdD\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>T : 613-566-4789<br>E/C: lmcivor@mus-nature.ca<br>nature.ca [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-17T21:02:02+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Laurel McIvor</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;e177926e.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;453f958b.1407">   <title>talk and sci-fi movie model? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;453f958b.1407</link>   <description> Hi, has anyone heard of a caf\ufffd\ufffd or the like featuring a scientist giving a talk as an intro to a fiction (sci-fi) movie? Any ideas, especially with any research or evaluation attached would be appreciated. Feel free to email off-list: stofer@ufl.edu<br>[Katie Stofer]<br>Thanks!   </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-17T19:37:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stofer, Kathryn (Katie)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;453f958b.1407</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;d1a0cf33.1406">   <title>Events at Bournemouth University next week </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;d1a0cf33.1406</link>   <description> Dear fans of Caf\ufffd\ufffd Scientifique,<br><br>Next week at Bournemouth University, we have over 150 free events taking place as part of our Festival of Learning - which is open to the public. Fancy going on a kitchen safari to see what bacteria lurk in your food? How about unleashing your inner monkey, uncovering the history that lies beneath Hengistbury Head, or finding out how best to market your business? Events include: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-03T18:57:04+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rebecca Edwards</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;d1a0cf33.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;860a10ed.1405">   <title>ethics of experimental medicine during a pandemic - 6th and 7th June 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;860a10ed.1405</link>   <description> Ethics of Experimental Medicine during a Pandemic<br>Two day conference, 6th and 7th June 2014<br>Royal College of Physicians, London<br><br>Objectives for conference<br><br>* To bring together opinion leaders in politics, science, public health, pharmaceutics, regulators and bioethicists to advance policy on this issue.<br>* To review suggestions and approaches proposed in the Meeting Report of the WHO Technical Consultation held in 2009 on Research Ethics in International Epidemic Response, and develop guidance in this area.<br>* To suggest training material for researchers and ethics committees based on this conference and on the resulting guidance. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-06T17:03:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Edwards, Sarah</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;860a10ed.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;c830f886.1404">   <title>Re: CAFE-SCI Digest - 16 Mar 2014 to 13 Apr 2014 (#2014-10) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;c830f886.1404</link>   <description> Like Ben, I wanted to find a way to collect our memories and thoughts<br>about Duncan. If you would like to contribute something, there is a link<br>from the front page of the cafe website (www.cafescientifique.org).<br>Thanks to Steve for setting it up. Ann<br><br>On 14.04.2014 12:36,<br>the.Duke.of.URL wrote:<br><br>&gt; This is dreadful news. I am unable to say<br>anything more.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; \ufffd\ufffd<br>&gt;<br>&gt; _LARRY_<br>&gt; \ufffd\ufffd<br>&gt; DR L BROWNSTEIN<br>&gt; [ALT-E] [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-14T22:08:10+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ann Grand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;c830f886.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;9ccc85a8.1404">   <title>Re: CAFE-SCI Digest - 16 Mar 2014 to 13 Apr 2014 (#2014-10) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;9ccc85a8.1404</link>   <description> Wow. This is completely unexpected and I am in shock from this news: physically in shock.<br><br>Duncan deeply inspired me. Really it was his selflessness that inspired me most. I always felt that Duncan cared deeply, but never about ownership. That combination struck me as an essential magic that makes grassroots movements happen. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-14T18:58:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ben Wiehe</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;9ccc85a8.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;8e1703c3.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;8e1703c3.1404</link>   <description> Hi Ann<br><br>So very sad to hear about Duncan. He was a clever, kind, funny, wise man - one of the most interesting and inspirational people I've ever been lucky enough to work with. He'll be missed by many.<br><br>The years I spent working alongside Duncan - and of course you and Tom - developing Cafe Sci in schools were a hugely rewarding time. Working with Duncan was always stimulating and thought-provoking (and sometimes just provoking!). His vision of talking to teenagers about science "on their terms" challenged and changed the way science is perceived for many students in many [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-14T14:41:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mary</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;8e1703c3.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;ff5da2c1.1404">   <title>Re: CAFE-SCI Digest - 16 Mar 2014 to 13 Apr 2014 (#2014-10) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;ff5da2c1.1404</link>   <description> This is dreadful news. I am unable to say anything more.<br><br>larry<br><br>Dr L Brownstein<br>[Alt-e] l.brownstein@leeds.ac.uk<br><br>------ Original Message ------<br>From: &quot;CAFE-SCI automatic digest system&quot; &lt;LISTSERV@jiscmail.ac.uk&gt;<br>To: CAFE-SCI@jiscmail.ac.uk<br>Sent: 14/04/2014 00:02:10<br>Subject: CAFE-SCI Digest - 16 Mar 2014 to 13 Apr 2014 (#2014-10)<br><br>&gt;<br>&gt;CAFE-SCI Digest - 16 Mar 2014 to 13 Apr 2014 (#2014-10)Table of<br>&gt;contents:Sad news about Duncan Dallas (9) Sad news about Duncan<br>&gt;DallasSad news about Duncan Dallas (04/13)<br>&gt;From: Ann Grand &lt;ann@ANNGRAND.CO.UK&gt; Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas<br>&gt;(04/13)<br>&gt;From: &quot;Allison B. Sekuler&quot; &lt;sekuler@MCMASTER.CA&gt; Re: Sad news about<br>&gt;Duncan Dallas (04/13)<br>>From: John Bibby <johnbibbyjohnbibby@GMAIL.COM> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-14T11:36:00+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>the.Duke.of.URL</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;ff5da2c1.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;daee25c0.1404">   <title>Re: CAFE-SCI Digest - 16 Mar 2014 to 13 Apr 2014 (#2014-10) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;daee25c0.1404</link>   <description> Ann,<br><br>Thank you for letting us know of Duncan’s passing. He was always so encouraging and supportive of everyone’s efforts to launch a local cafe scientifique program. Without his encouragement and guidance, our program would have been much more difficult to develop.<br><br>It is telling that his last email to us all was asking whether this list serv was still valuable and the outpouring of folks who said yes and wrote about their activities was really exciting to me. I hope that Duncan felt the same excitement in seeing how every one responded so positively. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-13T20:35:28-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michelle Hall</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;daee25c0.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;9086e787.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;9086e787.1404</link>   <description> Certainly the idea of a virtual SciCafe sounds intriguing, &amp; it would be<br>fitting too.<br>best wishes<br>Alison<br><br>On 14 April 2014 09:34, Ann Grand &lt;ann@anngrand.co.uk&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; Dear Allison and indeed, everyone<br>&gt;<br>&gt; I have asked Ness Collingridge (who was a friend and television colleague<br>&gt; of Duncan's, as well as a founder member of the Glasgow and Hong Kong<br>&gt; cafes) to pass on all your thoughts and condolences to Duncan's sons. It<br>&gt; was Ness who emailed me to let me know Duncan had died.<br>&gt;<br>> I really hope we can make a virtual international [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-14T11:32:07+12:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alison Campbell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;9086e787.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;7c02ca0b.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;7c02ca0b.1404</link>   <description> Dear Allison and indeed, everyone<br><br>I have asked Ness Collingridge (who was a friend and television<br>colleague of Duncan's, as well as a founder member of the Glasgow and<br>Hong Kong cafes) to pass on all your thoughts and condolences to<br>Duncan's sons. It was Ness who emailed me to let me know Duncan had died. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-13T22:34:15+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ann Grand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;7c02ca0b.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;c1f4a54.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;c1f4a54.1404</link>   <description> Note that Monty Harper (creator of &quot;Songs from the Science Frontier,&quot; http://www.montyharper.com) was one of our guests on a virtual Caf\ufffd\ufffd we did on music and mind last year, and he would be great to have as a guest if we choose to do something on a larger, international scale. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-13T17:32:59-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Allison B. Sekuler</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;c1f4a54.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;3fd1eff3.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;3fd1eff3.1404</link>   <description> From Hamilton NZ to Hamilton ON, Duncan will be missed.<br><br>It would be wonderful if we could find a way to honour him, perhaps through a virtual international Caf\ufffd\ufffd (or series of Caf\ufffd\ufffds). We have piloted some of those through #ScienceSunday on Google+, and it would be a great way to pay homage to Duncan as well as to bring a number of our caf\ufffd\ufffd organizers closer together. Anyone who is interested, just let me know. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-13T17:12:33-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Allison B. Sekuler</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;3fd1eff3.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;6ff07620.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;6ff07620.1404</link>   <description> I'm so very sorry to hear this - sincere condolences from NZ. Duncan will<br>be sadly missed.<br>regards<br>Alison<br><br>On 14 April 2014 07:49, Ann Grand &lt;ann@anngrand.co.uk&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; Dear cafe organisers<br>&gt;<br>&gt; I am saddened to have to tell you that Duncan Dallas - founder of cafe<br>&gt; scientifique in the UK and long-standing supporter of cafe scientifique<br>&gt; world-wide - died yesterday after a short illness.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Duncan was totally committed to the ideals and philosophy of cafe<br>&gt; scientifique and to increasing its reach across the world; most recently<br>> his work with the cafe [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-14T08:42:57+12:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alison Campbell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;6ff07620.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;9e37957f.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;9e37957f.1404</link>   <description> Dear Ann and Cafe Organisers,<br>That's very sad to hear. I had the privilege of setting up the original UK network, overseen by Duncan and Tom Shakespeare and funded initially by the Wellcome Trust. His idea seemed so sensible and obvious I was constantly surprised that Cafe Scis didn't already exist everywhere. I<br>He had a real mix of intellect, common sense and humanity and it was a pleasure to know him and work with him. It's testament to the strength of his idea that Cafe Scis now exist worldwide.<br>Best wishes,<br>Teresa [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-13T20:22:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Teresa Anderson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;9e37957f.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;33f3fa96.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;33f3fa96.1404</link>   <description> We are heartbroken. When I read Duncan's brief note in a May 1999 Nature, about his new idea, my life changed and Duncan became a hero to me. It was wonderful over the years for us to become his too-rarely-met friends and especially fun to be with him at the wonderful occasional international gatherings of organizers. We will miss and never forget him. Ann, we have special thoughts for you at this time. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-13T14:16:54-06:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Cohen, John</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;33f3fa96.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;e22c75c4.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;e22c75c4.1404</link>   <description> Very sad indeed - Duncan was inspirational. So sorry I did not see more of<br>him, although he lived so near.<br><br>JOHN BIBBY (York)<br><br>On 13 April 2014 20:54, Allison B. Sekuler &lt;sekuler@mcmaster.ca&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; That is such sad, and unxpected, news. If there is anything we can do from<br>&gt; Canada to help honour him - maybe help organize a virtual, worldwide Caf\ufffd\ufffd??<br>&gt; - please let us know.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Best<br>&gt; Allison<br>&gt;<br>&gt; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<br>&gt; Allison B. Sekuler, Ph.D.<br>&gt; Professor, Department of Psychology, Neuroscience &amp; Behaviour (PNB)<br>> Associate Vice-President and Dean (Graduate Studies), McMaster [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-13T21:04:21+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>John Bibby</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;e22c75c4.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;40acf186.1404">   <title>Re: Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;40acf186.1404</link>   <description> That is such sad, and unxpected, news. If there is anything we can do from Canada to help honour him - maybe help organize a virtual, worldwide Caf\ufffd\ufffd?? - please let us know.<br><br>Best<br>Allison    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-13T15:54:48-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Allison B. Sekuler</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;40acf186.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;35671112.1404">   <title>Sad news about Duncan Dallas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;35671112.1404</link>   <description> Dear cafe organisers<br><br>I am saddened to have to tell you that Duncan Dallas - founder of cafe scientifique in the UK and long-standing supporter of cafe scientifique world-wide - died yesterday after a short illness.<br><br>Duncan was totally committed to the ideals and philosophy of cafe scientifique and to increasing its reach across the world; most recently his work with the cafe sci schools project in Uganda. The cafe scientifique network will continue to be a tribute to his vision. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-13T20:49:17+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ann Grand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CAFE-SCI;35671112.1404</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
